(Simplified: 莸)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 猶 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 猶 [ yóu ] similar to, just like, as
①古書上指一種有臭味的草：薰蕕。
②落葉小灌木，葉子卵形或披針形，花淡藍色，蒴果成熟後分裂成四個小堅果。供觀賞，全株可入藥。

蕕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yóu］
［《廣韻》以周切，平尤，以。］
“莸1”的繁体字。
草名。似细芦，蔓生水边，有恶臭。常比喻恶人。

蕕字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蕕； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1057第42
【唐韻】以周切，音猶。【說文】水邊草也。卽《爾雅》?，蔓于。　又臭草。【本草註】其氣?臭，故謂之蕕。蕕者，?也，朽木臭也。【左傳·僖四年】一薰一蕕。　又地名。【晉書·慕容㒞載記】劉寧屯據蕕城，降於苻氏。　又【類篇】以九切，音酉。義同。　【集韻】同?。

Traditional characters for "莸1".
Cursive name. It resembles a thin reed, trailing by the water, and has a stench. Often compared to the wicked.

[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Jian Zi] 　莸; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1057 Page 42
[Tang Yun] Cut in Zhou Dynasty, with still sound. [Said the text] Waterside grass is also.卽 "Er Ya"?, Man Yu.　Smelly grass. 【Notes on Materia Medica】Its odor is smelly, so it is called "Chen". He, you, the rotten wood smells too. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Four Years] One Xun and One Pun.　Also place name. [Book of Jin·Murong 㒞 Records] Liu Ning Tun was based in Jucheng and descended to the Fu clan.　[Classes] with nine cuts, sound unitary. The same meaning.　【Jiyun】Same as?.
